pull.title: doc: mention MAKE=gmake workaround when building on a BSD

events.body:
Code Review ACK db146ecd7fabff3457102c9a6ef35d2bd1b7c3b0
Would like it if we took the opportunity to make the syntax highlighting hints more uniform but no worries. (I'm guessing "shell" means POSIX-compliant shell?)

verification.payload:
tree be47272ccbffd59e172e1b8549701a919df4dcaa
parent ce87d5613a5537b68cf23e7bc25c1e3770704ff9
author emu <emu@inbox.srvmin.network> 1581531399 +0000

doc: mention MAKE=gmake workaround when building on a BSD

Fixes: #14404

events.message:
doc: mention MAKE=gmake workaround when building on a BSD

Fixes: #14404

events.body: Given the syntax highlighting was pointed out twice, I've pushed to fix that up. I settled on using `bash` because that resulted in more highlighting in the editor I was looking at.  On GitHub using `bash` vs `shell` doesn't seem to make a difference.

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18340/commits/84a46a9b93671b899faf3900936904199d92daaf

These changes to the FreeBSD installation instructions broke travis Linux badly: [heap-use-after-free (pid=27489)](https://travis-ci.org/github/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/663739815#L4596)!

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -50,7 +50,7 @@ export BDB_PREFIX="$PWD/db4"
 
 ### Building Bitcoin Core
 
-**Important**: use `gmake`, not `make`. The non-GNU `make` will exit with a horrible error.
+**Important**: Use `gmake` (the non-GNU `make` will exit with an error).
 
 Preparation:
 ```bash
comments.body: nit: since you replaced `bash` with `shell` in `build-netbsd.md`, if you would be updating the patch, maybe `s/bash/shell/` also here in `build-openbsd.md`. But the patch is good to go as is IMO since its purpose is to deal with `MAKE=gmake` issue.
